alert.note: Alert for Clayton; Fayette (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 7:53AM CST until January 19 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Accumulating Snow Continues For Parts of the Area... .Many areas saw accumulations of 4-7 inches of snow thus far, with the exception of southwest Wisconsin and adjacent northeast Iowa where 2-4 inches fell. Accumulating snow will continue near and west of a line from Eau Claire Wisconsin, to Rochester Minnesota, to Charles City Iowa with 1 to 2 inches expected today. Lighter snowfall is expected to continue roughly along and north of the I-90 corridor with accumulations of an inch or less. Road conditions are expected to improve through the day with temperatures near freezing making road treatments effective. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Light snow and patchy freezing drizzle. Little additional accumulation. * WHERE...In Iowa, Fayette and Clayton Counties. In Wisconsin, Crawford, Richland and Grant Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
